content: Yes, Georgetown University offers several opportunities for Political Science majors to gain practical experience outside of the classroom, including internships, fellowships, and study abroad programs. Georgetown has one of the largest and most well-established internship programs in the country, and students have access to a vast network of organizations in Washington, DC, including government agencies, lobbying groups, media outlets, and non-profits. Students can also participate in a variety of research and fieldwork opportunities through the university's different research centers, such as the Center for Political Economy and Center for Democracy and Civil Society. Additionally, Georgetown offers study abroad programs specifically focused on political science in countries such as Argentina, Chile, and South Africa.
